title: Dan Campbell finds yet another way to keep Dolphins players motivated and excited
text:
Dan Campbell finds yet another way to keep Dolphins players motivated and excited Can Campbell's physical Dolphins continue to win? 
X's and Omar: Sun-Sentinel's Omar Kelly and CBS 12's Matt Lincoln talk about the future of Dan Campbell's physical Dolphins team. 
X's and Omar: Sun-Sentinel's Omar Kelly and CBS 12's Matt Lincoln talk about the future of Dan Campbell's physical Dolphins team. Chris Perkins Contact Reporter South Florida Sun Sentinel Dan Campbell develops a new, rugged practice drill 
Dolphins interim coach Dan Campbell has done it again. 
Campbell, who has had his players compete in mid-practice 1-on-1 drills, first-team offense vs. first-team defense drills, and even a tug-of-war, devised another interesting practice tactic Wednesday. 
This time, young players had to battle their way out of a circle of veteran players. 
Campbell, who once said he wanted his players to “violently compete,” gathered his team at midfield after calisthenics and before the actual practice began. 
Then all heck broke loose. The scene resembled a giant rugby scrum. 
Campbell had the young players get in the middle of a circle. They were surrounded by veterans. Then the youngsters find their way outside the circle as veterans tried to keep them herded inside. Have Dolphins transformed from finesse to physical team? 
X's and Omar: Sun-Sentinel's Omar Kelly and CBS 12's Matt Lincoln discuss the Dolphins situation as they prepare for the Texans.

“That’s just something to get them going a little bit,” Campbell said. “There’s not much to it. 
“When you do that, and you have the young guys in the middle and they have to find a way to get outisde the circle it kind of gets everybody fired up a little bit. That’s all it was, it just created a little bit of energy. 
“Not that we needed it, you just don’t want to take the chance. I wanted to make sure we had energy going into the practice and that just helps a little bit.” 
Campbell said the drill wasn’t anything he’d done or seen before. Campbell still stirring things up at Dolphins practice 
Dolphins interim coach Dan Campbell challenged his young players to break out of a circle of veterans early in practice Wednesday as he found another way to keep the enthusiasm going.

“It was just something I thought of,” he said off-handedly. “There was something else I had in my mind, but I didn’t want to do it. So that was what I came up with. 
“Anyway, it was good, they enjoyed it. And it’s fun. They’re just messing around with each other.”
